intro: Azara dentata, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood or Brazilian mahogany, is a tropical tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and aromatic properties. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, white or pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains small, black seeds.
